p.value: Donated by Lisa Fox in 2009 and 2014. The accession numbers associated with these gifts are 2009.249 and 2014.249.
The collection is organized into five series based on format:

Lisa Fox was a leading dancer with the Merce Cunningham Dance Company from 1976-1980 and was a choreographer with the Lisa Fox Danse for over thirty years. Curt Royston is best known for his proficiency in a variety of media: painting, sculpture, photography, film, and video, and often in combination. His work has been shown extensively throughout the United States and Europe including a 1987 one-man exhibition at the Whitney Museum of American Art. Together Royston and Fox collaborated on a series of multimedia installations, as well as a number of 16mm dance-based films throughout the 1980s, the most popular of which is "In Artificial Light" (1983).

extent.value: in 8 record cartons, 2 manuscript boxes, 17 jewel cases, 2 film cans, and 1 flat file folder.

abstract.value: The Lisa Fox and Curt Royston Papers consists of materials created by Lisa and Curt's multimedia collaborations. This collection contains reviews, photographs, transparencies, posters, video recordings, and sound recordings. Materials date from 1980 to 1988.

physloc.value: Some materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form:

Identification of item, date (if known); Lisa Fox and Curt Royston Papers; MSS 249; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
In 2018 materials from accretion 2014.249 were processed and intellectually incorporated into the collection. Materials were housed in archival folders and boxes.

head.value: Related Material at Fales Library and Special Collections

p.value: This collection contains reviews, photographs, transparencies, posters, film, video and sound recordings related to the multimedia collaborations of Lisa Fox and Curt Royston. Materials date from 1980 to 1988.

Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Lisa Fox and Curt Royston was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
